trans-unit.source: Represents the binding element used to specify an HTTPS transport for transmitting messages.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpsTransportBindingElement> class is the starting point for creating a custom binding that implements the HTTPS transport protocol.
HTTPS is the primary transport used for secure interoperability purposes.
HTTPS is supported by the [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] to ensure interoperability with other Web services stacks.

The [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] service model uses this class to create factory objects that implement the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelFactory> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelListener> interfaces.
These factory objects, in turn, create the channels and listeners that transmit SOAP messages using the HTTPS protocol.

You control the configuration of the factories that this class creates by setting its properties, such as: <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpsTransportBindingElement.RequireClientCertificate%2A>.

You can also set properties on the base class, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpTransportBindingElement>, such as: <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpTransportBindingElement.AuthenticationScheme%2A>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpTransportBindingElement.HostNameComparisonMode%2A>, and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpTransportBindingElement.MaxBufferSize%2A>.

You can also set properties on the base class <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TransportBindingElement>, such as: <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TransportBindingElement.ManualAddressing%2A>, and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TransportBindingElement.MaxBufferPoolSize%2A>.
For a complete list of properties, see <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TransportBindingElement>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpsTransportBindingElement"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpsTransportBindingElement"></xref> class.
This method is a copy constructor used to clone (make another copy of) the binding element.
An instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpsTransportBindingElement"></xref> class.
Creates a channel factory of a specified type that can be used to create a channel.
Returns a channel factory that is configured based on the values set in the transport binding element.
<xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref> members that describe bindings, behaviors, contracts and other information required to create the channel factory.
Type of channel.
A channel factory of the specified type that is configured based on the values set in the transport binding element.
context cannot be `null`.
Creates a channel listener of a specified type that can be used to create a channel.
A channel listener that is configured based on the values set in the transport binding element.
<xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref> members that describe bindings, behaviors, contracts and other information required to create the channel factory.
Type of channel.
A channel listener of the specified type.
context cannot be `null`.
Creates a copy of the current binding element.
A copy of the current binding element.
Gets a specified object from the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref>.
This method gets the specified object from the base class, or from one of that class's ancestors.
The object returned is usually a collection of properties, for example an object that implements <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ISecurityCapabilities>.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref>.
The object to get.
The specified object from the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref>, or `null` if the object isn't found.
Gets the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlElement"></xref> that represents the transport token used in the security binding.
This is used to generate WSDL for the associated service.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlElement"></xref> that represents the transport token used in the security binding.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether SSL client authentication is required.
`true` if SSL client authentication is required; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false.`
Returns the URI scheme for the transport.
This method is provided to enable binding validation against base addresses.
Returns the URI scheme for the transport, which is "HTTPS".
